ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Nonorganic hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Indicated by positive Stenger test, erratic 'sawtooth' audiometric configuration, and poor agreement between SRT and PTA.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Confirmed upon retest when patient was consistent; consistent with history of mastoidectomy and perforation.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Ossicular discontinuity with Otitis Media
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Identified by otologist and CT scan; explains conductive component and otalgia.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and configuration.
To assess speech reception and recognition, and check agreement with pure-tone thresholds.
To evaluate for nonorganic hearing loss given the asymmetry.
To assess middle ear function, though deferred due to pain.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presented with reported left hearing loss and otalgia. Testing revealed a mild sensorineural loss in the right ear. Left ear results were highly erratic and inconsistent with organic pathology. A positive Stenger test confirmed nonorganic hearing loss in the left ear. Immittance was deferred due to pain.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Mild low-frequency SNHL rising to normal, sloping to moderately severe in high frequencies. Left ear: Erratic 'sawtooth' configuration (profound to mild to profound) deemed unreliable.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 18 dB HL, WRS 86%. Left ear: SRT 53 dB HL (poor agreement with PTA), WRS 8%.

tests.name: Stenger test
tests.result_summary: Positive at 500 and 1000 Hz, indicating false responses.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Not measured due to patient report of otalgia and history of surgery.

proposed_items: Medical management for otitis media and perforation
counseling_actions: Discuss the inconsistency of results and the positive Stenger findings gently
Encourage consistent responses for future testing
Explain that true hearing levels could not be determined at the initial visit

escalation.rationale_short: For management of otitis media, TM perforation, and evaluation of ossicular discontinuity.

follow_up_plan.objective: Retest hearing to obtain reliable thresholds after encouraging consistency.

expected_outcome: CT scan: Revealed ossicular discontinuity likely due to a previous cholesteatoma.
Follow-up Audiometry: Patient was more consistent and results revealed a bilateral mild to moderate mixed hearing loss.
